attributes.action: abandon the Government’s current proposals to change the taxation of gaming machines from the current system of Amusement Machine Licence Duty and VAT to a Gross Profits Tax system.  We believe that this change would have a disastrous effect on many businesses which are already in a fragile commercial situation due to the current economic climate and recent additional legislative and regulatory changes.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
In the 2009 Budget, the Treasury announced its intention to revisit the question of whether Amusement Machine Licence Duty (AMLD) should be replaced by a gross profits tax (GPT).  This is now subject to consultation. A previous consultation in 2003 identified substantive policy reasons against a move to GPT. Weight had also been given to the considerable uncertainty and economic difficulties facing the sector at the time – factors which have only become more pressing in the intervening six years.
Combined with the global economic deterioration, the smoking ban and structural unintended consequences of the Gambling Act 2005, the gaming machine sector continues to face uncertain and difficult market conditions. A change to GPT will make these problems worse.
